bus_type.comments: Communication mode of primary bus as per COM port api. Supports : 0 - i2c; 1 - spi; 3 - i3c_sdr; 4 - i3c_hdr_ddr; 5 - i3c_i2c_legacy

bus_instance.comments: Custom bus instance to be used for primary communication with sensor

qup_instance.comments: SSC QUP instance to be used for primary communication with sensor

slave_config.comments: Slave config for the actuator line. Only non-zero slave cfg will get registered with COM port api. Value here is right-shifted by 1, w.r.t sensor xml

min_bus_speed_khz.comments: Min communication speed supported by bus

max_bus_speed_khz.comments: Max communication speed supported by bus

reg_addr_type.comments: Type of reg address used in communication; 0,1,2 values represent 8,16,32 bit as per COM port api

burst_support.comments: Whether or not actuator supports burst data writes, ie, transferring data to write into multiple contiguous registers

.sensor_pwr_rail_info.comments: LDO information required for the ASC actuator, reflecting those in PMIC driver and CamX xml

.vaf.comments: As per vaf subsection in camx xml

resource_str.comments: LDO string identifier, e.g. '/pmic/client/aoc_avdd' if using legacy PAM style, or 'L4M_E1' if using new direct device voting style

voltage.comments: Voltage for the power rail in mV (applicable only for new direct device voting style)

ldo_pin_value_to_pwr_on.comments: Actuator is toggled on when the pin value matches given value

.ldo_pin.comments: Pin info for LDO. If an external LDO is used by OEMs, they can put corresponding pin information (in same structure as GPIO pins) to drive the LDO

pin_num.comments: GPIO pin number where FW should toggle to control the LDO; set as -1 if PMIC is used instead of external LDO

is_chip_pin.comments: Whether the client is to be handled by TLMM (mux) or LPI; If using SSC GPIO pin no. instead of MSM pin no., is_chip_pin should be 0

drive_strength.comments: Drive strength supported by the LDO pin; Range 0-7 indicating 2,4,6,...,16mA

pull_type.comments: Pull-type of the LDO pin; Range 0-3 indicating no-pull, pull-down, pull-keep, pull-up

irq_trigger_type.comments: Type of associated IRQ trigger, Range 0-4 indicating rising-edge, falling-edge, dual-edge, high-level, low-level

.misc_params.comments: Miscellanous params to control actuator operation

settling_time_ms.comments: How long to wait (in milliseconds) for the sensor actuator to settle down, before streaming on sensor

remote_pwr_toggle_needed.comments: Indicates the power rail for the actuator cannot be controlled from DSP and thus requires HLOS to remotely toggle on DSP's behalf

num_actuator_steps.comments: Number of steps for actuator to converge
